page.title: 15BARLOW VILLAGE 2
page.content: {The village}is a mixture of{old and {new houses}around the{Church}which was founded in the{twelfth century}and is called{St. Lawrence's.}Many people come here from other villages to worship.Some people in the village work in{Sheffield or Chesterfield}and a few are{unemployed}or take{seasonal {work}on the{local farms.}There is one man who mends{lawn mowers}and also {cars.}Another man makes{fibre-glass {boats.}There is the{Barlow Hunt}which meets twice a week in the{winter.It is a means by which{foxes}are{hunted}down and{killed}because they{kill small {animals}on the farms.It is called a {blood sport}and people{ride horses across country with{hounds}at their feet to hunt down the fox.After it is killed, the{fox's tail or 'brush' is {cut off as a keepsake.}On{Boxing Day many people come to watch this sport.
